titleproper.value:
Guide to the James Olinkiewicz Collection of Brooklyn Daily Eagle Postcards
                    <lb/>1905-1907
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 355</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Joseph Ditta

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-05-30T11:55-0400</date>

unittitle.value:
James Olinkiewicz collection of 
                <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Daily Eagle</emph> postcards

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
A complete set of the 486 postcards depicting Brooklyn scenes issued by the 
                <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Daily Eagle</emph> newspaper.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

This collection should be cited as the 
                <emph render="bold">James Olinkiewicz Collection of Brooklyn Daily Eagle Postcards, PR 355, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society</emph>.

The best introduction to the cards is Richard L. Dutton's 
                <emph render="italic">Brooklyn: The Brooklyn Daily Eagle Postcards, 1905-1907</emph> (Arcadia Publishing, 2004).

Note that the dates in the container list signify when the postcards were issued, 
                <emph render="bolditalic">NOT</emph> when the photographs were taken. In some cases the cards reproduce images that were made at least thirteen to fifteen years earlier than the 1905-1907 period. See, for instance, 
                <extref ns2:href="https://archive.org/details/souvenirofourpub00whit">Souvenir of Our Public Schools</extref> (New York: E. J. Whitlock, 1892), the source of many of the images on the 
                <emph render="italic">Eagle’s</emph> school building postcards.

subject.value: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Buildings, structures, etc.

dsc.value:
Brooklyn Eagle Postcard Series 1 1 of 1 1905 November 13-18 Scope and Contents

001 | Litchfield Mansion, Prospect Park. 002 | Erasmus Hall High School. (Now [sic] Building.) 003 | Entrance of the Museum of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences. (Under Construction.) 004 | The Williamsburgh Bridge, From Broadway, Brooklyn, to Delancey St., Manhattan. 005 | Excavating for the New Long Island Railroad Station. 006 | Old Academy of Music, Montague St. (Burned Nov. 30, 1903.)

(Under Construction.) 008 | Soldiers’ and Sailors’ Memorial Arch, Main Entrance, Prospect Park. 009 | View of Brooklyn Water Front, 1840. 010 | Packer Collegiate Institute, Joralemon St., Near Clinton. Founded in 1844. 011 | New Giant Twin-Screw S.S. Amerika of the Hamburg-American Line. 012 | Croquet Club House, Prospect Park.

Bedford and Lafayette Aves. 017 | A Play Near the Goal Line in the Boys’ High School-Pratt Institute Game at Washington Park. 018 | Bronze Statue of Abraham Lincoln, Prospect Park.
